intro: Laggera oloptera, commonly known as the African blueweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Laggera oloptera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
